summary_markdown:
# About Actual AI

Actual AI, operating under the parent company SprintReview, Inc., was founded on June 21, 2024 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/sprintreview-ai). The company focuses on enhancing software development processes by providing tools that bridge the gap between traditional performance metrics and actual developer productivity. 

## Products and Services

Actual AI offers a software service that automates the generation of commit messages, pull request summaries, and release notes. This is achieved by analyzing software development code and content from third-party platforms like Jira and GitHub. The service is designed to improve transparency and efficiency in software development. The company's main products include:

- **Automation Tool**: This tool drafts commit messages, pull request summaries, and release notes.
- **SaaS Platform**: Offers both hosted features and on-premises solutions tailored for software development teams.

## Business Model and Customers

Actual AI operates on a B2B model, targeting software development teams and organizations that aim to enhance their engineering processes and improve developer satisfaction. The company employs a simple and transparent pricing model based on the GitHub seats model, which automatically adjusts charges based on usage.

## Company Culture and Careers

Actual AI promotes a culture of transparency, collaboration, and user feedback. The company values justice in the workplace, ensuring that developers are recognized for their contributions and that performance reviews are fair and unbiased. The company is actively hiring for various positions, including:

- **Infrastructure Engineer**: Responsible for backend architecture and infrastructure stability.
- **Frontend Engineer**: Focuses on user experience and frontend development.

## Privacy and Terms

Actual AI is committed to user privacy and data protection. Users must agree to the terms of service to utilize the services provided by Actual AI. For more details, users can visit the [Actual AI website](https://www.actual.ai/).

# Key Personnel

The leadership team at Actual AI is composed of experienced professionals in software engineering and product development. They focus on building a robust infrastructure and enhancing user experience. Specific names and roles of key personnel were not provided in the available information.

# News

As of the latest available information, there are no specific news articles or events reported about Actual AI. The company is relatively new, having been founded in mid-2024, and may not yet have significant media coverage. For updates, users can follow their [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/actualai) and [Twitter](https://x.com/actual_ai_) profiles.

For further inquiries, users can reach out via the [Contact Us](https://www.actual.ai/contact-us) page on their website.

# [Infrastructure Engineer](https://www.actual.ai/founding-backend-infrastructure-engineer)
Own the architecture that drives our platform’s growth and stability. As the lead engineer responsible for our backend and infrastructure, you'll play a crucial role in scaling our SaaS platform, building out on-premises solutions, and supporting our desktop application infrastructure.

This role is hybrid in Seattle, WA, USA.

What exactly you will do:

Own our backend and infrastructure. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the core infrastructure that powers our services, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.

Optimize and scale. Work on optimizing our systems for performance and scalability as we grow, ensuring that our platform can handle increasing load and complexity.

Collaborate with frontend and product teams. Work closely with other teams to integrate backend solutions that enhance the user experience.

Build our team. As we grow, you will be a part recruiting and interviewing new engineers, building out a world-class backend and infrastructure team.

At a minimum you should:

Have shipped reliable, scalable, and secure backend systems, preferably with a significant user base.

Be comfortable with selecting and implementing the right tools and frameworks for the job, with significant experience in languages like Python, Go, or Node.js, and familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.

Be autonomous and driven. You will be an owner, with the autonomy to match.

Enjoy solving complex technical challenges and have a deep understanding of system design, distributed systems, and infrastructure best practices.

Have experience with database management and optimization, particularly with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases.

Bonuses you may have:

# [Founding Frontend Engineer](https://www.actual.ai/founding-frontend-engineer)
We are looking for a passionate and visionary frontend engineer to completely own the future of the user experience for all of our services. You are needed immediately to help with our rapidly expanding SaaS platform, as well as building out our desktop application & on-premises offerings.

This role is hybrid in Seattle, WA, USA.

What exactly you will do:

Own our frontend infrastructure. You will be responsible for planning the implementation of new features, testing, gathering feedback, and iterating.

Talk to customers. Both scheduled and unscheduled, you will be directly meeting with our users to understand exactly how we can build the best experiences.

Help to build our team. We are growing, and you will help to recruit and interview new engineers.

At a minimum you should:

Have shipped beautiful, responsive, and intuitive products, preferably to a relatively large user base.

Be very comfortable with seeking out the right stack and framework to get the job done. We don’t have a hard requirement on specifics here, and you shouldn’t either - our stack is constantly evolving to meet our needs. However, significant base experience with Typescript, React, CSS is of course required.

Be autonomous and driven. You will be an owner, with the autonomy to match.

Enjoy speaking with users directly. We believe that our users’ feedback is one of our most valuable resources, and you must be able to turn that into actionable information.

Bonuses:

reviews.pros:
I got messaged on linkedin by a headhunter with the most tailored and compelling message I ever received. Due to this, my interest was sparked and I went for a first phonecall. In the second call, their SVP Sales really convinced me with his fire and ambition which is why I followed their invitation to Paris. After TC had taken care of my entire trip to Paris, I had an amazing day with them, one of the best steaks of my life for lunch and at the end, there was an offer that I took immediately.
The onboarding and the first days were amazing. There is a very positive culture and you feel that the people want to grow something big. Can't wait to put in all the work in order to contribute to the big goal this company has :-)
reviews.summary: Very smooth hiring process and onboarding

reviews.cons: As soon as something comes up, I will post it here.
reviews.pros: It only took two weeks from the first contact with the company till the signed contract. I saw the position on LinkedIn, to which I replied around 10 o'clock in the morning and on the same day I had my first Interview with the Sales Director. This already showed me the high flexibility of an young, dynamic company. The days after I had two Skype Interviews with the HR in Paris and SVP of Sales. They asked me a lot about my motivation and why I have chosen a StartUp. After Signing the contract the start was ASAP, starting with a three days onboarding in Paris, to learn a lot about the product, the team and the culture in this company. I am very glad to be here.

reviews.cons: If I wanted to be fussy, I'd say we're missing a rooftop ;-)
reviews.pros:
Tinyclues is still at the stage where the various teams work closely together towards the same goal (from my previous experiences, you tend to lose this when the company gets bigger). 2 of the 4 execs arrived very recently and the team is already addressing the right issues adequately, ensuring that everyone is aligned.
The work environment is great (nice premises, ideally located in Paris with many restaurants around and easy public transportation access).
One of the greatest advantage offered to employees : the possibility to work from home up to 3 days a week. A HUGE plus when you want a garden and need to live outside of Paris for that !

reviews.advice: Going global will mean inevitable cultural fragmentation, so keep up the good work with communication and a high level of visibility, plus spend the money on bringing teams together.
reviews.cons: Now in Scale-Up mode with hefty 2nd Round investment, company needs to take care to look after the influx of people and clients. Good foundations are in place.

employerResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review! We appreciate hearing about your input and are glad to learn that you enjoyed working with your team members and that you believe in our company. We work hard on keeping the best company culture throughout our 5 offices, and we care deeply about our associates well-being. If you’d like to share further feedback, please email at hr@tinyclues.com. 

The HR Team

reviews.pros:
People are smart, kind and collaborative.
Product is truly unique and it works.
Culture & Vision is inspiring and energising.
Transparency & communication, from the very top, make you feel integral to success with a real voice. 
Great operational setup - scaleable internal tech infrastructure and quick to adapt. You get the tools and help you need.
Great career development. Interview and Onboarding was quick and painless.

reviews.cons: Nothing that comes to mind, it's been great so far.
reviews.pros:
The company does a great job at balancing a strong tech culture with an ambitious market / business vision: deeply redefining B2C marketing.
Actual AI  (as opposed to just surfing the AI hype). Very exciting to be at forefront of AI innovation! 
Proven traction both in the US and in Europe.
Culture of transparency and employee involvement
Fast-growing + international expansion
Lots of exciting challenges and room for personal growth, for all teams (tech / sales / marketing)
Charismatic CEO
Lots of perks
Great vibe overall!

reviews.advice: Keep your core values of great product and customer satisfaction!
reviews.cons: The usual challenges coming with rapid growth, nothing that isn't matched with a willingness to fix and improve.
reviews.pros: Everyone talks about AI, Tinyclues has been doing it for quite a few years and it's great to be at the forefront of technology. The technical people behind the product are borderline geniuses,  we get good support from head office and simply very nice people overall.

reviews.cons: Targets can be a bit unrealistic but that is something very minor.  Amount contributed to Retirement plan is slightly higher than in other companies, great for long term, but takes a toll on the paycheck.

employerResponses.response:
We really appreciate that you took the time to write this considerate review. It’s great to read that you enjoyed our perks and working with our colleagues! Regarding retirement plan, we want to offer the best coverage to our employees, because we believe that it’s important to plan for the future. If you’d like to share further feedback, please email us at hr@tinyclues.com! We wish you all the best.

The HR Team

reviews.pros: I worked at one of the satellite offices as an SDR. The compensation was fair, great perks that include travel to the Paris HQ, as well as a team retreat to the French Alps. People are friendly, helpful, and team oriented. It was a very pleasant experience. Benefits include a private health insurance.
reviews.summary: Fair compensation, great perks, a good workplace

reviews.advice: Apply kindness (for real), help people grow.
reviews.cons:
* surprised by how some things can be political
* virtual kindness by the management layer, managers can be tough/obnoxious with a non-helpful behavior

We wish you all the best. 
The HR team

glassdoor_result.summary_markdown:
# Employee Sentiments

## Reasons Employees Like Working for Actual AI

### Positive Work Environment
- "Great innovative startup. The technical people behind the product are borderline geniuses, we get good support from head office and simply very nice people overall." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2017-06-14)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW15470967.htm)
- "Real startup spirit, great enthusiastic team, great market opportunity, amazing offices in Paris." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2017-12-06)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW18217968.htm)
- "You work with brilliant people, highly motivated. Workspace is perfect." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2019-08-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW28657420.htm)

### Strong Company Culture
- "The company does a great job at balancing a strong tech culture with an ambitious market/business vision." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2018-04-10)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW20091640.htm)
- "Leadership is really strong and makes effort to be as transparent as possible at all times." [(Customer Success Manager (CSM), Glassdoor, 2020-10-27)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW37665187.htm)

### Career Development Opportunities
- "Lots of exciting challenges and room for personal growth, for all teams (tech/sales/marketing)." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2018-04-10)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW20091640.htm)
- "Great career development. Interview and onboarding was quick and painless." [(Sales, Glassdoor, 2018-08-28)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW22193468.htm)

## Reasons Employees Dislike Working for Actual AI

### Management and Political Issues
- "Surprised by how some things can be political; managers can be tough/obnoxious with a non-helpful behavior." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2017-08-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW16485423.htm)
- "Still trying to find the footing in some areas." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2019-10-31)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW30134710.htm)

### Workload and Stress
- "Fast-paced environment: nothing is written in advance and conditions can be stressful." [(Senior Account Executive, Glassdoor, 2019-11-24)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW30555754.htm)
- "You will like working for Tinyclues if you are willing to roll up your sleeves and do lots of different things." [(Customer Success Manager (CSM), Glassdoor, 2020-10-27)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW37665187.htm)

## Key Events or Changes in the Company

### Growth and Expansion
- "Now in Scale-Up mode with hefty 2nd Round investment, company needs to take care to look after the influx of people and clients." [(Sales, Glassdoor, 2018-08-28)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW22193468.htm)
- "The company vision and accompanied excitement for that vision is electrifying." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2019-10-31)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW30134710.htm)

### Cultural Shifts
- "I feel a culture shift happening and you need to slow down, pay attention, and be careful with how you manage it." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2019-10-31)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW30134710.htm)

## Specific Details About Benefits

### Work-Life Balance
- "Remote 3 day per week available." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2019-06-21)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW27531253.htm)
- "The possibility to work from home up to 3 days a week. A HUGE plus when you want a garden and need to live outside of Paris for that!" [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2019-09-24)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW29431813.htm)

### Compensation and Perks
- "Fair compensation, great perks that include travel to the Paris HQ, as well as a team retreat to the French Alps." [(Sales Development Representative, Glassdoor, 2019-07-10)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW27907217.htm)
- "Benefits include a private health insurance." [(Sales Development Representative, Glassdoor, 2019-07-10)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Tinyclues-RVW27907217.htm)
